title: Force light theme and update dark UI surfaces for readability

requirements.summary: Force the app to always render in light theme (white background) regardless of the userâ€™s system theme.
acceptanceCriteria: On a device/browser set to dark mode, the app still renders with a light/white background.
The root page background (body/app shell) appears white/light rather than black/dark across all routes (normal, payment success, payment failure, loading state).

file_operations.description: Update the next-themes ThemeProvider configuration to force the light theme (e.g., forcedTheme="light" and disable system theming) so the app never applies the dark theme classes/variables, including for loading and payment success/failure renders.

Add a small startup safeguard to ensure any persisted/previously-applied dark theme class is removed from the root element before the app renders, ensuring a consistently white/light background on initial load.

requirements.summary: Replace explicitly dark UI surfaces (Header brand pill and Hero intro box) with light/neutral fills so text remains highly readable on the white background.
acceptanceCriteria: The Header brand area no longer uses a black background that reduces readability against the white/light page (e.g., replace with a light/neutral surface using existing theme tokens).
The Hero intro text block (neon green bordered box) uses a light/white (or very light) fill so the paragraph text is easy to read on the white-themed page.
Text contrast meets a clearly readable standard in the Hero intro block, Header, and other primary copy areas (no dark-on-dark or low-contrast combinations introduced by the theme switch).

file_operations.description: Update the Header brand pill/button styling to remove the explicit dark/black background and replace it with a light/neutral surface (e.g., card/background + border + subtle shadow) while preserving the existing layout and hover/scroll behavior.

Update the .neon-green-intro-box utility class to use a light/white (or very light) background fill (keeping the neon green border) and ensure foreground text remains high-contrast and readable on the new light theme.
